sub_topic: Finding the perimeter of a rectangle.
message_1: A rectangle has a length of 10 centimeters and a width of 5 centimeters. What is the perimeter of the rectangle in centimeters?
message_2:
The perimeter of a rectangle can be found using the formula P = 2(L + W), where P is the perimeter, L is the length, and W is the width.

In this case, the length (L) is 10 centimeters and the width (W) is 5 centimeters. Plugging these values into the formula, we get:

P = 2(10 + 5)
P = 2(15)
P = 30

The perimeter of the rectangle is 30 centimeters.
